intro: Griffithia rugulosa, commonly known as the rugose griffithia, is a rare and ancient plant species native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and conifer-like appearance. The plant has a unique morphology, featuring small, scale-like leaves and a compact, shrub-like growth habit. It is considered a living fossil, with its lineage dating back to the Mesozoic era. Due to its limited distribution and ecological sensitivity, it is classified as endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
